Field Detail

FORMAT_CHANGED

public static final java.lang.String FORMAT_CHANGED
"Format Changed" - This is a messaging String sent out when any combo box is changed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FORMAT_LIST

public static final java.lang.String FORMAT_LIST
"Format List" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about all of the combo boxes for this control. The value that this key references is a Vector containing an array of Objects. Each Object[] represents a combo box.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SELECTED_LIST

public static final java.lang.String SELECTED_LIST
"Selected List" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the selected index of each combo box at the time the save occurred. The value that this key references is an int[] matching the number of Object[] in the FORMAT_LIST Vector.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TOOL_TIP_LIST

public static final java.lang.String TOOL_TIP_LIST
"Tool Tip List" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the tool tips of each combo box at the time the save occurred. The value that this key references is a String[] matching the number of Object[] in the FORMAT_LIST Vector.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

FormatControl

public FormatControl()
Default constructor - specifies no title, with one JComboBox.

FormatControl

public FormatControl(java.lang.String title)
Same functionality as default constructor, only this constructor allows for title specification of the border.

Parameters:

FormatControl

public FormatControl(int num_format_parameters)
Use this constructor to specify a number JComboBoxes, each for a different format.

Parameters:
num_format_parameters -

FormatControl

public FormatControl(java.util.Vector format_lists)
Use this constructor to specify a number JComboBoxes by providing a list of Object[]. Each Object[] contains the list of format options.

Parameters:
format_lists - A vector of Object[].
Method Detail

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IViewControl
Overrides:
getObjectState in class ViewControl
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

getLastChangedIndex

public int getLastChangedIndex()
Get the index of the COMBO BOX that was most recently changed. If this method is called before a combo box has been changed, -1 is returned.

Returns:
The index of the last combo box to be changed. Negative one (-1) is returned if no combo boxes have been changed.

getLastChangedSelectedIndex

public int getLastChangedSelectedIndex()
Get the index of the SELECTED ITEM from the combo box that was most recently changed. If this method is called before a combo box has been changed, -1 is returned.

Returns:
The index of the selected item for the last combo box to be changed. Negative one (-1) is returned if no combo boxes have been changed.

getSelectedIndex

public int getSelectedIndex(int combo_box_index)
Given the array index, get the index of the currently selected object in the combo box at combo_box_index.

Parameters:
combo_box_index - The index of the combo box where the selected index is being found.
Returns:
The index of the selected Object displayed in the combo box at combo_box_index.

setSelectedIndex

public void setSelectedIndex(int combo_box_index,
                             int select_index)
Given the array index, set the selected object in the combo box at combo_box_index.

Parameters:
combo_box_index - The index of the combo box where the selected index is being found.
select_index - The index of the desired item to be selected for combo box found at combo_box_index.

getToolTipText

public java.lang.String getToolTipText(int combo_box_index)
Get the tool tips for the combo box at combo_box_index.

Parameters:
combo_box_index - The combo box with tool tips.
Returns:
The String tool tip or null if invalid index.

setToolTipText

public void setToolTipText(int combo_box_index,
                           java.lang.String text)
Set the tool tips for the combo box at combo_box_index.

Parameters:
combo_box_index - The combo box needing tool tips.
text - The tool tip text being added to the combo box.

getFormats

public java.util.Vector getFormats()
Get the labels of the combo boxes in the form of a Vector containing a list of Object[], with each array corresponding to a combo box.

Returns:
Vector containing multiple Object[], each corresponding to a combo box.

setFormats

public void setFormats(java.util.Vector format_lists)
This method will create the combo boxes and add listeners to each. Calling this method will clear/remove any previously existing combo boxes.

Parameters:
format_lists - Vector containing list of Object[], each corresponding to a combo box.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
For testing purposes only... If "cm" is passed as an argument, the ControlManager will link controls.
